messages.title: 5 MORE YEARS OF GORDON BROWN OR CHANGE WITH THE CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: In just a few weeks we will have the most important election for a generation. Our economy is burdened by huge debts and millions are out of work. Our society is broken by crime and irresponsible behaviour. Our political system is a mess. We can't go on like this. A Conservative government will take bold action on all fronts. We'll cut Gordon Brown's waste and debt to get our economy moving. We'll support families and back people who do the right thing to encourage responsibility in our society and we'll make sure pensioners are supported as well.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour are now the party of unemployment. Conservatives will get Britain working again by boosting enterprise. We will abolish jobs taxes on the first ten jobs created by new businesses, promote green jobs and help people off welfare and into work.

David Cameron has made the NHS number one priority for. We will back it and we want to improve it for everyone. The Conservatives will increase spending on the NHS every year. We are the only party to have made this commitment.

We will create a new generation of schools run by teachers not weighed down by state bureaucracy, not micro managed by politicians. Parents will get power to start smaller schools with smaller classes, good behaviour, great teachers and restored confidence in the curriculum.

Families are the foundation of a strong society. Our plans to improve Sure Start with 4,200 extra health visitors, extend flexible working, improve prisons, and leave and open new schools will help make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe.

issues.economy: We'll cut Gordon Brown's waste and debt to get our economy moving. We'll support families and back people who do the right thing to encourage responsibility in our society and we'll make sure pensioners are supported as well.
issues.education: We will create a new generation of schools run by teachers not weighed down by state bureaucracy, not micro managed by politicians.
issues.governance: We need big changes in our political system too. We've led the way on cleaning up MPs' expenses and we'll finish the job by scrapping the perks and cutting the cost of Parliament.
issues.health: David Cameron has made the NHS number one priority for. We will back it and we want to improve it for everyone. The Conservatives will increase spending on the NHS every year.

leaflet.additionalNotes: This leaflet presents a comparison of choices at the election, highlighting the difference in policy direction between the Conservatives and Gordon Brown's tenure. It emphasizes the need for substantial change in various sectors such as employment, healthcare, education, and family support.
